messages.content: I've been there. NEVER AGAIN.
not completely true, a relic is always there without you having to play or even draw a power, hence even saving energy and draws (also this relic is not bound to any character)
I was referring to hourglass

depending on the circumstances six-point can be better 
imho hourglas is only good if u playing a really slow def deck or a deck that tries to make enemies sip their turn

I don't know how fair it is to compare this to mercury hourglass. Yes, they both deal damage, but one is completely static, and the other can be build around and supported to trigger more or less frequently. I would agree that on average, mercury hourglass is usually better, especially due to the lower rarity, because the damage is AOE, and because it triggers at the start of every fight immediately. You could compare it to A Thousand Cuts, but as CT points out, you have a relic on turn 1 of every fight, without having to draw a card or spend any energy on it, so it's actually better than ATC in several ways even if it can't be upgraded or deal AOE damage.

Six-Point Brand on the other hand, shines more in single enemy fights, and can potentially be triggered multiple times in one turn in decks that can spam tons of cards. There is serious potential as a damage engine in decks that can go infinite or semi-infinite, or that play tons of "airy" cards. It's also a stacking relic like pen nib or ink bottle, it remembers the number of charges on it between fights. If you play carefully, you can try to leave it on 4 or 5 at the end of fights in order to trigger it very quickly in the next fight (That is definitely more annoying, and less consistent than mercury hourglass). What I really like about this relic is that it rewards building your deck differently, and that it can enable certain playstyles that are unusual for some characters. It is quite possible that it would be a more balanced relic at uncommon (I don't think changing any of the numbers makes sense, since they are a fun and direct reference to hexaghost). If you find it early enough in a run, you can build around it in a way to really utilize it's damage effectively and trigger it often.
Yeah I think this would work best in the uncommon pool. Compared to other rare relics this is seldom a relic I'd want to see.
I'm okay with it uncommon
I think it's actually better than the strength one
hexa happen to have 0 uncommon relic too

Common Relic / All / Downfall

*Backed by the study of a thousand books. Knowledge is power!*

messages.content: Vanilla one
Vajra

I personally think this relic is pretty good. A simplified way of looking at this relic is that it makes all of the cards you play do 1 damage. Since downfall has so many card spammers this relic can do 12+ damage in a turn; which is very valuable to have for free. Using six-point brand is a lot of work though, since you have to end fights with it on the number 5; much like an ink bottle.
even on characters that don't spam as frequently like hermit and hexaghost this still provides some bonus damage for no real cost
it's just so so in downfall mode, and even weaker on new neow but pretty good in vanilal I guess
I do agree that this relic *feels* bad to use though, its nothing exciting and its annoying to min max it to squeeze out as much damage as possible.
please try the test ver if you are interested in new neow
